product_name: bareMineralsORIGINAL Mineral Veil Talc-Free Pressed Setting Powder
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganWeightless and talc-free, bareMinerals ORIGINAL Mineral Veil Talc-Free Pressed Setting Powder sets and extends makeup wear with a soft-matte finish. The pressed setting powder instantly blurs the look of fine lines and imperfections.
details: DetailsBenefitsLightweight pressed powder sets makeup, extends wear and improves the look of skinBlurs the look of lines and imperfections with a soft-matte finish - no filter neededDermatologist-tested, non-comedogenic and hypoallergenicProven to reduce the look of pores over time**Based on a 4-week Canadian study of 40 subjectsKey IngredientsCACAO AND SHEA BUTTERS: Nourish and condition skinVITAMIN E: Provides antioxidant protection to defend against environmental stressorsFormulated WithoutAll bareMinerals products are free of parabens, phthalates, formaldehyde, chemical sunscreens, triclosan, triclocarban, propylene glycol, mineral oil, coal tar and microbeadsThis product is also free of talcItem 2633097How To UsePair with Supreme Finisher Brush (not included) for all-over sheer coverage to set foundation:Swirl brush into the powder to pick up a small amount.Tap to remove any excess powder.Lightly sweep onto your skin where desired.Pair with puff (included) for targeted application or touch ups:Lightly press into the powder to pick up a small amount.Gently press and roll onto areas where desired.Use edge of the sponge to apply powder onto smaller areas like the under eye and around the nose.Blot to touch up throughout the day.IngredientsMica, Silica, Diisostearyl Malate, Magnesium Myristate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Butter, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Chlorphenesin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Stearic Acid, Palmitic Acid, Lauric Acid, Quercetin. +/- (May Contain/Peut Contenir) Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499).
how_to_use: Pair with Supreme Finisher Brush (not included) for all-over sheer coverage to set foundation:Swirl brush into the powder to pick up a small amount.Tap to remove any excess powder.Lightly sweep onto your skin where desired.Pair with puff (included) for targeted application or touch ups:Lightly press into the powder to pick up a small amount.Gently press and roll onto areas where desired.Use edge of the sponge to apply powder onto smaller areas like the under eye and around the nose.Blot to touch up throughout the day.

reviews.headline: Good Powder, Fragile Case
reviews.comments: This powder is good but it shatters in the case. I like to bring this in my purse for touch-ups so this is very inconvenient. I wish the packaging was sturdier to prevent this.

reviews.headline: Lâ™¡VE IT ðŸ©·ðŸ©·ðŸ©·
reviews.comments: It feels very soft and silky to the skin. I never have to reapply and my skin looks amazing! On days where I don't want to wear makeup. I just put this Mineral Veil on and I instantly look like I have a filter on my face, very natural yet no pores or acne scars show. I absolutely love this product....

reviews.headline: Switched from BM Loose Mineral Veil to Pressed Powder
reviews.comments: I'm 45 yrs old, with skin on the dry side, and have used BM Mineral Veil for more than a decade. This pressed powder has pros and cons. Pros Include: coverage smooths fine lines, it goes great over heavy or light foundation (I use MAC), covers nicely without a foundation, and looks great over eye cream (I use Dermalogica) and/or concealer (I use Bobby Brown). Cons: Over time, the powder puff applicator absorbs any cream or sunscreen you have on your face (even after I let it absorb), making the powder puff pretty useless after a month even after cleaning it gently. I ended up using Real Techniques sponge to apply.

reviews.headline: Good-but hardened over time
reviews.comments: Overall this was a very good powder, however, over time it began to significantly harden, making a lot of the powder unusable. It did take a while for this to happen, so if you are a daily user it will probably be fine.

reviews.headline: like the brand - costumers at Ulta seem disrespectful though
reviews.comments: when i opened the package at home the powder inside was budged with other make up and used. The store at Ulta also felt really messy and rough. when you buy make-up I think its important that the store is well maintained.

reviews.headline: Great product!
reviews.comments: This powder is i feel like a full coverage mat finish! It covers very well especially as a finishing. Love this product
Works great and a great size

reviews.headline: The best powder !!!
reviews.comments: The best powder I've ever had! Very good ingredients, it does not dry the skin but gently mattifies it. The skin looks fresh and healthy all day long!

reviews.headline: Good if you don't have acne prone skin
reviews.comments: I liked this product when I wore it, and I was really glad to find a talc free option. I have very acne-prone skin though and I have broken out every time I wear this product. I think it is the shea butter ingredient that is the problem in this product

reviews.headline: Very smooth
reviews.comments: I use powder to control shine, no foundation underneath. This works great .

reviews.headline: Beautiful finish!
reviews.comments: This setting powder is great! I used it over the BM pressed powder foundation and it creates a beautiful finish, and controls oiliness without drying out the skin. Makes my skin look nice and healthy. Recommend!

reviews.headline: Forever a favorite product
reviews.comments: After I finish this with my cc cream moisturizer it leaves me a flawless look. Considering I have large pores it helps a lot with going out.

reviews.headline: I would buy this again
reviews.comments: I would buy this again

reviews.headline: Sheer&Not Cakey!
reviews.comments: Very lightweight, Sheer, and Sets Your MakeUp Well Without Settling In Creases, or Fine Lines. A little Goes A Long Way. I am the shade "sheer deep," and when i seen it in person it was much lighter then it looked onlineâ€¦â€¦. HOWEVER, it still matched well, and did an amazing job setting my makeup, since it is the last step of my makeup before applying setting spray. Ive bever used anyyhjng from Bare Minerals Before, But Im SOLD on this lightweight product. FYI i am a caramel shade WOC, ans "sheer deep" was a good match for me. Although, I am shocked that was the darkest shade they had, because it's definitely more people darker then me. DIVERSITY is always needed & appreciated!

reviews.headline: Hidden gem
reviews.comments: I purchased this pressed powder for everyday touch ups and it works amazing, for me itÂ´s no to matte for setting the foundation but it really blurs the pores and it looks like your skin, so pleased to know itÂ´s vegan, cruelty free and talc free!

reviews.headline: Current fav
reviews.comments: I hit pan on this pretty quickly but i use it every day. I tried the hourglass mineral veil powder and the elf halo glo ? Powder and ive used a LancÃ´me powder too. I like that this is just transparent and its also talc free. It blurs my pore's really well too. I might go back and get the tinted  version of this as well just to see if it would give my face just a little color. I am very pale and I usually need a blush or a bronzer after i put my setting powder on just because i am so pale. Definitely going to repurchase the transparent shade tho when it runs out. I really like it! Oh and last time I bought it, it came with a sponge which was actually really good.

reviews.headline: Great product keeps define away all day..
reviews.comments: Very light weight, I'm silky. Do not cake or feel heavy on my face.

media.headline: Switched from BM Loose Mineral Veil to Pressed Powder
media.caption: BM Pressed Powder Translucent

media.headline: I didn't like it, but my neice likes it.
Broken in million pieces after 5 uses

faceoff_positive.comments: Ok, so I have Vitiligo and my skin has multiple shades and it looks really patchy all the time. I'm actually really ok with it. I take very good care of the health of my skin and am proud of the fact that at 44 years of age I do not need foundation. I do, however, need powder. Influenster and Bare Minerals asked me to try this Pressed Mineral Veil powder and I was quite impressed. Despite the patchy color of my skin, the powder is easy to put on with a brush and with the enclosed applicator/pouf, and sits on skin like a super light dream. It flawlessly mattifys shininess and yet blurs imperfections and makes skin glow. I loved every second of using this powder and have bumped my HD powder out of my daily routine and only use this now. The Compact is great too because you can take it on the go, (something one couldn't do easily with the loose powder), and the mirror inside the compact reaches the entire surface area of the lid of the compact. For some reason that tickles me. I recommend this to everyone! Only reason it's not 5 stars, it made my skin on my forehead a bit drier than I liked. I have dry skin, but I moisturize it to death. I feel like the powder sucked that moisture away on my forehead only. Other than that, I love it and I use it daily!
faceoff_positive.headline: Wow just Wow

faceoff_negative.comments: This product was very lightweight which was the only thing good I would compare the texture to Makeup forever high definition powder BUT definitely not the performance of it......left a ghostly white reflecting effect very weird. DEFINITELY did NOT leave my skin matte at all not without makeup and not with using over matte foundation...nothing. My skin is combination at the moment, some dry areas sometimes tzone gets a little oily. End of the day my whole face was greasy and makeup had lots of creases. It wasnt even that hot outside, actually no humidity and my face was oily slick. When I patted it with a tissue, you could see the oil transfer. This product was a waste of my time. I have tried the foundation mineral powders from this brand and had the same problem actually worse, I had gotten acne on my face and rashes. This brand is not for me I'm done, I do not recommend. There was nothing MATTE about this product.
faceoff_negative.headline: Don't bother
